page.title: 16A Visit to the Local.
page.content: No village would be complete with out its local. Dilhorne is no exception for she has four Public Houses to chose from. Each with their own identity and pesonal charms. Two cater for the locals and two for visits entering the village after a run out in the countryside. One of these is the "Charle Bassett", named after a local personality. Here in the garden the children can play in an old Mother Hubbard Shoe whilst the parents enjoy a quiet drink.The publican informed us that about 90 people visited regularly and that the most common drink in winter was bitter,whilst in summer, larger proved the favourite. For children coke was the winner. The favourite bar meal was Scampi and Chips, followed by sandwiches. Out of interest we inquired about the cost of a drink and how much was drunk.
